snippet: The dispute is also being closely watched as a first major test of whether, and how, financially strained states and cities can cut the benefits of their workers and retirees.
abstract: Rhode Island Supreme Court Judge Sarah Taft-Carter is presiding over five pension-related lawsuits by public employee unions, and whether she can remain impartial in cases is a matter of scrutiny, as she and family members are in a pension system; dispute is also being closely watched as a first major test of whether, and how, financially strained states and cities can cut the benefits of their workers and retirees.
lead_paragraph: The dispute is also being closely watched as a first major test of whether, and how, financially strained states and cities can cut the benefits of their workers and retirees.

headline.seo: Rhode Island Judge Has Stake in Pension Case Outcome
headline.main: Rhode Island Judge Has Stake in Pension Case Outcome
headline.print_headline: Conflict Is Issue In a Pension Suit
